action.action-desc: Mrs. Fischbach introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To direct the Secretary of Labor to establish that the adverse effect wage rate shall be 125 percent of a certain minimum wage, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the H–2A Reform Act of 2022.

section.header: Reforming admission of temporary H–2A workers

subsection.text: Not later than 60 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Secretary of Labor shall issue such regulations necessary to establish that the adverse effect wage rate shall be the difference of—

paragraph.text: the amount that is 125 percent of the Federal minimum wage required by the Fair Labor Standards Act; and
the value of any other benefit provided to the alien.

subsection.text: Section 218 of the Immigration and Nationality Act (8 U.S.C. 1188) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (i), by adding at the end the following:
The term adverse effect wage rate means the difference of—

subparagraph.text: the amount that is 125 percent of the Federal minimum wage required by the Fair Labor Standards Act; and
the value of any other benefit provided to the alien.

paragraph.text: by adding at the end the following:

subsection.text: The Secretary of Labor shall ensure that an H–2A worker do not adversely affect the wage of a United States worker by ensuring that the H–2A worker is paid the adverse effect wage rate.
Section 101(a)(15)(H)(ii)(a) of the Immigration and Nationality Act (8 U.S.C. 1101(a)(15)(H)(ii)(a)) is amended by striking of a temporary or seasonal nature,.
